title: How to Make Quinoa Croquettes

steps.headline: Cook the quinoa in a little water or stock in the way that you would normally prepare it (or follow the instructions on the box).
Tip the quinoa into a big bowl once cooked and let it cool.
Add the carrot, onion, celery/parsley and garlic to the pan.
Remove after 3 to 4 minutes of cooking.
Mix the quinoa with the egg, flour and yeast flakes.
Make small round balls with the mixture, using your hands.
Place the little balls into the frying pan over medium heat.
steps.description: Gently flatten them with a fork to form short, thick croquette (patty) shapes.

steps.headline: Continue cooking the croquettes until they are done.
Serve.
steps.description: Add sauce for additional flavor. Good choices include hot sauce, yogurt, garlic or parsley sauce.

text: Cook the quinoa in a little water or stock in the way that you would normally prepare it (or follow the instructions on the box).  Tip the quinoa into a big bowl once cooked and let it cool.  Add the carrot, onion, celery/parsley and garlic to the pan. Place over medium heat. Remove after 3 to 4 minutes of cooking.  Mix the quinoa with the egg, flour and yeast flakes. Add the vegetables. Salt and pepper to taste.  Make small round balls with the mixture, using your hands.  Place the little balls into the frying pan over medium heat. Gently flatten them with a fork to form short, thick croquette (patty) shapes. Continue cooking the croquettes until they are done. This should take about 10 minutes. Serve. Add sauce for additional flavor. Good choices include hot sauce, yogurt, garlic or parsley sauce.

Continue cooking the croquettes until they are done.
Good choices include hot sauce, yogurt, garlic or parsley sauce.
